titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader, May 10, 1875

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia Liberia
J Milton Turner
to Department of State
Washington
Nomination to the Department of Mr. Gabriel Moore Jr. to be appointed Vice Consul of the United States at Monrovia Republic of Liberia.

I have the honor now to comply with the instruction conveyed to me by the Department's despatch marked "Seperate," and dated the 25th of February 1875; desiring me under the Regulations, to nominate a suitable person to be appointed Vice-Consul of the United States at this point, to which instruction, I had the honor to allude in my No. 1. to you under date of April 15th 1875. The person
whom
Honorable
John L. Cadawalder
Assistant Secretary of State
whom I have determined very respectfully to nominate for the purpose mentioned: is named Gabriel Moore Jr.–a man of respectable connections and responsible standing here. Mr Moore is a citizen of Liberia, was born at this place, and is about 22 years of age.

I have the honor to be
Sir,
with expressions of high esteem
Your obedient servant
J Milton Turner
Since writing the above, Mr Moore informed that he is named Gabriel David Moore; I have to request that the difference be observed
